textBeforeTable: Resident Freshmen Dining Plans Please note: Residence hall students are required to participate in the University dining plan options, except residents of the Exchange Street Apartments with kitchens. We have a variety of dining plan options available to suit your style. The table below shows the plans available and the costs for each. Below that, you will find a detailed description of our most popular plans. Dining plan options and costs Safety Dining Plan Options and Costs Dining and Retail Options Living Learning Communities Residence Hall Rates Residence Hall Quick Facts Housing & Dining Health & Wellness Athletics Arts & Culture Activities & Organizations Menu Toggle navigation
textAfterTable: Freshmen living on campus are required to purchase a traditional or Rob's dining plan. My Dining Dollars can be used at on and off-campus locations. Details about this plan are lower on this page. Flex Plans For sophomores, juniors and seniors, these plans offer greater flexibility to use at numerous off-campus merchants. Blue Plan Cost/semester Cost/academic year 7 traditional meals per week + $300 in My Dining Dollars/Semester $1,424 $2,848 Gold Plan     10 traditional meals per week + $750 in My Dining Dollars/Semester $2,205 $4,410 Details about this plan are lower on this page. Non Resident Plans ** Light Blue Dining Plan Cost/semester Cost/academic year 4 meals per week at any on-campus dining operation. +$250 in My Dining Dollars/semester (excludes national brands)  $680 $1,360 Light Gold Dining Plan     5 meals per week at any on-campus dining operation + $150 My Dining Dollars/semester (excludes national brands) $680 $1,360 Five Plan     5 traditional
